text: Joba Murmu Karandih is a Santhali woman living in Jamshedpur who received the Sahitya Akademi's Children's Literature Award on November 14, 2017 due to her language contribution.http://jharkhandstatenews.com/article/top- stories/2393/joba-murmu-santali-writer-selected-for-bal-sahitya-award/ ==Life introduction== Joba Murmu is a school teacher and activist. She graduated in law and has an M.A. in Santhali and Hindi. ==Writing Assignment== She has written many stories in Santhali. His story 'Olen Baha' was given at the Sahitya Academy's Children's Literature Award 2017. She translated the stories of Premchand and Gitanjali of Rabindranath Thakur in Santhali. ==See also== * Indian Academy of Literature * Santali literature ==References == Category:Year of birth missing (living people) Category:Living people
title: Joba Murmu
